hp_raw: 100 ( fast healing 10 , mental rebirth,  negative healing )
markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Vetalarana Emergent](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1911)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A vetalarana emergent is inexperienced and ravenous, often caring more for the consumption of thoughts than the quality of the thoughts and memories consumed. These undead gluttons gorge themselves on memories, leaving a crowd of addled and terrified victims in their wake.

 Experienced emergents are cannier than their newly risen kin, stalking their chosen victims and being sure to abduct, kill, or render their victims comatose after draining their memories to ensure no witnesses remain to reveal the presence of a vetalarana.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 24

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 22

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Vampire_VetalaranaEmergent.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 8">[Vetalarana Emergent](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1911)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="CE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
<trait label="Vampire" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=242" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 162</row>

**Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), thoughtsense (precise) 100 feet

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +15, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +18, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +16, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +17

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +5

**Con** +4

**Int** +3

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [crossbow](/Weapons.aspx?ID=67)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 26 

**Fort** +14 

**Ref** +17 

**Will** +16 

</row>

**HP** 100
([fast healing 10](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15), mental rebirth, [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [_sleep_](/Spells.aspx?ID=288)

**Resistances**
[mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) 10, physical 10 (except [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375))

**Weaknesses**
vetalarana vulnerabilities

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, climb 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +20 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 2d8+9 slashing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_crossbow_ +20 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [reload 1](/Traits.aspx?ID=254)),
**Damage** 2d8+3 piercing

**Anticipatory Attack**   The vetalarana emergent uses consumed memories to anticipate their prey's movements. The vetalarana emergent's Strikes deal an additional 1d8 precision damage to creatures [stupefied](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) due to the vetalarana's Drain Thoughts.

**Drain Thoughts** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) When Draining Thoughts, the vetalarana emergent regains 10 HP.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-311" />
name: Vetalarana Emergent

These undead gluttons gorge themselves on memories, leaving a crowd of addled and terrified victims in their wake. Experienced emergents are cannier than their newly risen kin, stalking their chosen victims and being sure to abduct, kill, or render their victims comatose after draining their memories to ensure no witnesses remain to reveal the presence of a vetalarana.
